comments:
hi,

i use Birt 2.1 with eclipse 3.2.

i got this in my birt-xml-file:

<data-sources>
<oda-data-source extensionID="org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc" name="Data Source" id="39">
<text-property name="displayName">Data Source</text-property>
<property name="odaDriverClass">org.postgresql.Driver</property>
<property name="odaURL">jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/foo</property>
<property name="odaUser">foo_user</property>
<encrypted-property name="odaPassword">adfadsf</encrypted-property>
<property name="odaJndiName">java:foo.foo.foo</property>
</oda-data-source>
</data-sources>


I want to generate the html-report in my web-application.
So i use the report engine. All works fine.
Now the problem:

When i use Eclipse for creating the birt-xml-file, i specify the jdbc-connection
(as you see in my code). Moreover i specify jndi-name (as you see above).
When i use the report engine, the jdbc-connection is used first. if it fails, the jndi connection will be used. I want to always the jndi-connection when i generate the html page. How can i say the report engine, to use the jndi connection first? Is this possilble? 
(The ugly workaround would be, to change a property (e.g. "odaURL") in the xml file, to make sure, that the jdbc-connection fails)

-- orkus9

There is a mis-understanding of the JNDI usage in your description.

The correct sequence as described in Bugzilla #131662:
If the oda.jdbc data source property "odaJndiName" is specified with a non-empty value, it will first attempt to use the named JNDI resource to obtain a java.sql.Connection.  If it fails for any reason, then it will fall back to get a new jdbc connection directly from the jdbc driver, specified in the "odaURL" property.

When i change the username, host to XXX, no JNDI-Connection could be found. It seems so, that birt is not using the jndi connection first (see logfile).
Now the miracle:
When i change the jdbc-startdart-connection values like this:

 
private static void dropJDBCSettings(IReportRunnable design) {
final List contents = design.getDesignHandle().getModuleHandle().getAllDataSources();
for(int i = 0; i < contents.size(); i++) {
OdaDataSourceHandle dataSource = (OdaDataSourceHandle) contents.get(i);
try {
Object o = dataSource.getProperty("odaUser");
if(o != null) {
dataSource.setProperty("odaUser", "");
}
o = dataSource.getProperty("odaURL");
if(o != null) {
dataSource.setProperty("odaURL", "xxx");
}				
} catch (SemanticException e) {
throw new IllegalStateException(e.toString());
}			
}
}

Now the JNDI connection works fine. All i have done is:
adoUser = ""; odaURL="xxx";

When the jndi connection is used first, why i get the 
error (like in the logfile below).
I am totally confused. For me its not logical.

Please help me. :-(

- orkus9






Complete log-file:
